description:
By this type, an invoice will be generated based on PO No.

PO No will be saved in the Customer's Purchase Order field. PO No will show in the print.

If employees have the same PO No then come in one invoice otherwise separate separate invoices

Manpower Cost = Net Pay, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X2% if Non-Saudi, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X11.75% if Saudi, ERC Fee and Bank Transaction Charges taken from Project profile.

Sales Invoice Items Structure

Item CodeItem NameEmployeeQtyRate

Manpower CostEmployee 11

GosiEmployee 11
if more than one employee then two rows same as above will be added for each employee with the employee's name




ERC Fee
no of employees

no of employees

description:
By this type, invoices will be generated based on PO Nos. In the Employee master, we have PO management in which there are three options PO for Manpower, PO for Rotation, and PO for Neom Allowance.

So, Invoices will be generated for Each PO for Manpower with all employees that have same PO No.

The same flow will be used for PO for Rotation and PO for Neom Allowance

PO No will be saved in the Customer's Purchase Order field. PO No will show in the print.

Sales Invoice Items Structure for Manpower PO

Manpower Cost = Net Pay - Rotation Amount - Neom Allowance Amount, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X2% if Non-Saudi, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X11.75% if Saudi, ERC Fee and Bank Transaction Charges taken from Project profile.

Item CodeItem NameEmployeeQtyRate

Manpower CostEmployee 11

GosiEmployee 11

Manpower CostEmployee 21

GosiEmployee 21





if more than one employee then two rows same as above will be added for each employee with the employee's name




ERC Fee
no of employees

Bank Transaction Charges
no of employees

Sales Invoice Items Structure for Rotation PO

Reimbursement Expense = Amount of Salary Component for Rotation, Admin Fee = Reimbursement Expense X 10%

Item CodeItem NameEmployeeQtyRate

ReimbursementEmployee 11Reimbursement Expense

Admin Fee 10%Employee 11Admin Fee

ReimbursementEmployee 21Reimbursement Expense

Admin Fee 10%Employee 21Admin Fee
if more than one employee then two rows same as above will be added for each employee with the employee's name








Sales Invoice Items Structure for Neom Allowance PO

Value = Amount of Salary Component for Neom Allowance

Item CodeItem NameEmployeeQtyRate

Special AllowanceEmployee 11Value

Special AllowanceEmployee 21Value
if more than one employee then one row same as above will be added for each employee with the employee's name

type: Invoice based on per PO with other POs

description:
By this type, only one invoice will be generated containing only one row in the table with Location and Department Grand Total (Totals of each employee Manpower Cost(Net pay), Gosi, ERC Fee, and Bank Transaction Charges).

Manpower Cost = Net Pay, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X2% if Non-Saudi, Gosi = (Basic + Housing)X11.75% if Saudi, ERC Fee and Bank Transaction Charges taken from Project profile.

Sales Invoice Items Structure

Item CodeItem NameQtyRate
Manpower CostLogistics - Dammam1Grand Total

Explanation:

Like Locations: Riyadh, Dammam, Jeddah, Makkah, etc.

Under the Location, there are Multiple departments like Service, Logistics, WHS, Finance, etc.

So, a Separate Invoice will be generated on each pattern e.g.

1) invoice of employees that exist in Riyadh - Services

2) invoice of employees that exist in Riyadh - Logistics

3) invoice of employees that exist in Riyadh - WHS

4) invoice of employees that exist in Riyadh - Finance

So, the same above flow will be used for other locations and departments
name: One Invoice with all employees total dept under loc wise one line only
type: One Invoice with all employees total dept under loc wise one line only

description:
By this type, invoices will be generated based on Employees. One invoice for one Employee. PO No will be saved in the Customer's Purchase Order No in the Sales Invoice.

In this type, Rate (Invoicing Rate fetch from PO Management Doctype) and Quantity will be the Working days entered in the Payroll Invoice Generator.

Manpower Cost = Quantity(Working Days) x Rate

Sales Invoice Items Structure

Item CodeItem NameEmployeeQtyRateAmount

Manpower CostEmployeeWorking Days (From Payroll Invoice Generator)Invoicing Rate (From PO Management)Qty x Rate
